Title: The clock stops for legendary striker, Okonji dies at 83
Summary: Elder Lawrence Onweazu Okonji, a former striker and coach, passed away on Wednesday, November 12, at the age of 83 . Fondly called ‘Daddy of Soccer’ and ‘Goal Sniffer’, he died aged 83 .

Title: Oshiomhole criticises Obaseki’s govt, scores Okpebholo high
Summary: Adams Oshiomhole has criticised the immediate past administration in Edo North District . Oshomhole described groundbreakings that yielded no meaningful projects . He described the groundbreakingings as 'groundbreakingings that yield no meaningful project'

Title: Amupitan at INEC and the call of history
Summary: Prof. Joash Ojo Amupitan has been widely applauded for his personal qualities . The 58-year-old election umpire for Nigeria.. The appointment was widely applauded .

Title: Tinubu campaign posters disappear: What changed?
Summary: Tinubu's campaign posters that previously decorated the expressway to Abuja Airport have been pulled down overnight . A video that trended last week suggested the rapid cleanup was a response to President Trump’s message .

Title: Lagos reiterates commitment to environmental sustainability at EBC sensitisation programme
Summary: Lagos reiterates commitment to environmental sustainability at EBC sensitisation programme . The 2025 Environmental Bees Club (EBC) Members and Handlers’ Sensitisation Programme held in Alausa over the weekend .

Title: Customs intercepts endangered lion, patas monkeys at Seme Border
Summary: The Seme Border Command of the Nigeria Customs Service intercepted a lion cub and two patas monkeys . The animals were being transported illegally in a vehicle in violation of national and international wildlife protection laws .

Title: H1’25: Fidelity Bank grows gross earnings by 46% to N748.7bn
Summary: Fidelity Bank Plc recorded a gross earning of N748,7 billion for the half-year ended 30 June 2025, H1’25, representing a 46% growth from N512.9 billion recorded in the same period 2024, HI’24 . Highlights of the financial results were uploaded on the Nigerian Exchange Limited,

Title: OPS endorses N20bn container-insurance scheme to scrap deposit fees
Summary: OPS endorses N20bn container-insurance scheme to scrap deposit fees . The new scheme, designed to protect international trade, is backed by a consortium of insurers . OPS represented by Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture .

Title: Why North remains backward despite vast talent— Gov Sani
Summary: Kaduna State Governor, Senator Uba Sani, has lamented the slow pace of development in the North despite its abundance of skilled professionals . Senator Sani: Why North remains backward despite vast talent .

Title: End carnage in North East, CAN youth wing begs FG
Summary: CAN youth wing begs FG to end carnage in North East . “While some individuals may hold contrary opinions we who live here cannot mortgage our faith, voice, or conscience for temporary gain or political convenience”
